config.description: Global configurations for Novops and modules

environments.description:
Source of truth defining files and variables loaded by Novops

Environments are named uniquely (such as "dev", "prod"...) to allow for different configs to be loaded in various contexts

name.description:
Application name. Informational only.

If not specified, use current directory name

source_profile.description: Source profile. Must exist in config.

endpoint.description: Override endpoint for all AWS services Can be used with tools like LocalStack, for example http://localhost:4566/

profile.description:
AWS Profile name. Must exist locally in AWS config.

It's advised not to use this directly as profile name configuration is higly dependent on local configuration. Prefer using AWS_PROFILE environment variable where needed.

AwsSSMParamStoreInput.description: Reference an SSM Parameter config or secret

AwsSSMParameter.description:
Reference an SSM Parameter config or secret

Maps directly to GetParameter API. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/APIReference/API_GetParameter.html

with_decryption.description: Return decrypted values for secure string parameters. This flag is ignored for String and StringList parameter types.

AwsSecretsManagerSecret.description:
Structure to request a Secrets Manager secret

Maps directly to GetSecretValue API. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/apireference/API_GetSecretValue.html

version_id.description: The unique identifier of the version of the secret to retrieve.

version_stage.description: The staging label of the version of the secret to retrieve.

AwsSecretsManagerSecretInput.description: Reference an AWS Secret Manager secret

AzureKeyvaultSecret.description:
Maps directly to Keyvault Get Secret API

See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/keyvault/secrets/get-secret/get-secret?tabs=HTTP

field.description: Field in entry to use as value.

BytesResolvableInput.description: Any input to be used for file content.

dest.description:
Destination where file will be generated. Default to secure Novops working directory.

Setting this value may prevent file from being auto-deleted as it won't be managed in a safe location and may remain indefinitely.

name.description: File name to use when auto-generating file and variable name. if not set, the YAML key for file will be used

variable.description:
Environment variable name pointing to generated file.

Example: setting `NPM_TOKEN` will output an environment variable pointing to file path such as

`NPM_TOKEN: /run/user/1000/novops/dev/file_xxx`

GCloudSecretManagerSecret.description:
Structure to request a GCloud Secret Manager secret

See https://cloud.google.com/secret-manager/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.secrets/get

name.description: Name of the secret in the format projects/\*\/secrets/\*\/versions/\* Such as `projects/my-org-project/secrets/my-secret/latest` Or `projects/my-org-project/secrets/my-secret/42` for a specific version

validate_crc32c.description: Whether to validate crc32c checksum provided with secret (default: true)

HashiVaultAWSInput.description:
Reference AWS Secret Engine role to generate AWS credentials as environment variables.

Maps directly to Generate Credentials API. See https://developer.hashicorp.com/vault/api-docs/secret/aws#generate-credentials

mount.description: Secret Engine mount point. Default to 'aws'.

ttl.description: Generated token time to live. Example: "3600s"

aws.description: Use Vault AWS Secret Engine to generate temporary AWS credentials.

HashiVaultKeyValueV1.description: Reference a Key Value V1 secret

mount.description:
KV v1 mount point

default to "kv/"

HashiVaultKeyValueV1Input.description: Reference a Key Value V1 secret

HashiVaultKeyValueV2.description: Reference a Key Value V2 secret

mount.description:
KV v2 mount point

default to "secret/"

HashiVaultKeyValueV2Input.description: Reference a Key Value V2 secret

address.description:
Address in form http(s)://HOST:PORT

Example: https://vault.mycompany.org:8200

token.description:
Vault token as plain string

Use for testing only. DO NOT COMMIT NOVOPS CONFIG WITH THIS SET.

verify.description: Whether to enable TLS verify (true by default)

NovopsConfig.description: Global Novops configuration defining behavior for modules

environment.description: Default environment name, selected by default if no user input is provided

NovopsEnvironmentInput.description: Modules to be loaded for an environment. Each module defines one or more Input which will be resolved into Outputs (files & variables)

aws.description:
Assume an AWS Role from local config.

Outputs environment variables `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` and `AWS_SESSION_TOKEN` with temporary credentials for IAM Role.

files.description: Files resolving to concrete files on local filesystem and environment variables pointing to file

hashivault.description: Reference one or more Hashicorp Vault Secret Engines to generate either files or variables.

variables.description: Variables resolving to environment variables from provided source

StringResolvableInput.description: All possible inputs resolving to a string value
